review: I'm tempted by this little box, but Comcast in this area has bigtime bandwidth issues. Pixellated images and impromptu freeze frames while the feed catches up. And I'm not reading anything here about buffer capacity that might alleviate that. I even get that on HD broadcasts on the regular TV channels and I have to switch to the SD channels to continue watching. I've already tried Netfilx's streaming (my Blu-Ray player and my TiVo both can do streaming) and some movies have come through audio-only, so I gave that up. Whether you can have streaming at all is like that old sales cliché; it's all location location location.
author: R. L. MILLER
